especially of a disease or a condition, regularly found and very common among a particular group or in a particular area: endemic in Malaria is endemic in many of the hotter regions of the world.endemic among/to The disease is endemic among British sheep/to many British flocks.endemic racism/poverty/violence There is endemic racism/poverty/violence in many of the country's cities.
